Analyses based on bugsigdb.org 0.99.4
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Delivery Mode and the Meconium Microbiome
    • COVID-19 associated microbiome
    • An analysis of Most frequent taxa in Major Depression and Bipolar Disorder
    • The Irritable Bowel Syndrome-associated Microbiome
    • The Endometriosis-associated Microbiome

Delivery Mode and the Meconium Microbiome

2/24/2022

c-section_meconium_shaimaa.Rmd

Analysis objectives

  1. Import, recode, and subset data from bugsigdb.org
  2. Create a table of studies
  3. Calculate the frequency of appearance of each taxa in independent signatures and identify the most frequently reported taxa

Making sure packages are installed

Not evaluated in vignette:

if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
    install.packages("BiocManager")
BiocManager::install("bugsigdbr")
BiocManager::install(c("devtools", "tidyverse", "kableExtra"))
BiocManager::install(c("waldronlab/bugSigSimple", "waldronlab/BugSigDBStats"))

Load and subset data 

suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(bugSigSimple)
  library(BugSigDBStats)
  library(bugsigdbr)
  library(tidyverse)
  library(stringr)
  library(kableExtra)
  library(dplyr)
})
# use version="devel" and cache = FALSE to take the latest version from bugsigdb.org
dat <- bugsigdbr::importBugSigDB(version = "devel", cache = FALSE) 
dim(dat)
## [1] 2173   48
names(dat)
##  [1] "Study"                      "Study design"              
##  [3] "PMID"                       "DOI"                       
##  [5] "URL"                        "Authors"                   
##  [7] "Title"                      "Journal"                   
##  [9] "Year"                       "Experiment"                
## [11] "Location of subjects"       "Host species"              
## [13] "Body site"                  "UBERON ID"                 
## [15] "Condition"                  "EFO ID"                    
## [17] "Group 0 name"               "Group 1 name"              
## [19] "Group 1 definition"         "Group 0 sample size"       
## [21] "Group 1 sample size"        "Antibiotics exclusion"     
## [23] "Sequencing type"            "16S variable region"

## [47] "State"                      "Reviewer"

Subsetting 

included.pmid <-
  c(
    28018325,
    24614698,
    29207565,
    29459704,
    29538354,
    32012716,
    20566857,
    28512451,
    28112736,
    27362264
  )
subset.dat <-
  filter(dat, PMID %in% included.pmid) 
unique(subset.dat$`Group 0 name`)
##  [1] "vaginal delivery in mecomium"               
##  [2] "vaginal delivery after 7 days of delivery"  
##  [3] "vaginal delivery after 3 months of delivery"
##  [4] "vaginal delivery after 6 months of delivery"
##  [5] "vaginally born controls"                    
##  [6] ">/=33 weeks"                                
##  [7] "vaginal delivery at day 3"                  
##  [8] "vaginal delivery at day 5"                  
##  [9] "vaginal delivery at day 28"                 
## [10] "vaginal delivery at day 150"                
## [11] "vaginal delivery at day 365"                
## [12] "full-term delivery >39 weeks at day 3"      
## [13] "vaginal delivery"                           
## [14] "vaginal delivery in transitional stools"    
## [15] "mecomium in vaginal delivery"               
## [16] "mecomium in C-section delivery"             
## [17] "no"                                         
## [18] "without prenatal antibiotics usages"        
## [19] "without peripartum antibiotics usages"
included.group0 <-
  c(
    "vaginal delivery",
    "vaginally born controls",
    "vaginal delivery in mecomium",
    "vaginally born controls")
unique(subset.dat$`Group 1 name`)
##  [1] "C-section delivery"                             
##  [2] "cesarean premature birth"                       
##  [3] "infants <33 weeks gestational age"              
##  [4] "c-section"                                      
##  [5] "late preterm 34-36 weeks"                       
##  [6] "overall time point infants samples of c-section"
##  [7] "transitional stool"                             
##  [8] "Antimicrobials use during delivery yes"         
##  [9] "Maternal consumption of probiotics yes"         
## [10] "Furry pets at home yes"                         
## [11] "c-section delivery"                             
## [12] "C-section"                                      
## [13] "infants delivered to mothers with"
included.group1 <-
  c("c-section",
    "C-section",
    "c-section delivery",
    "C-section delivery")
subset.final <-
  filter(subset.dat, `Group 0 name` %in% included.group0 & `Group 1 name` %in% included.group1) %>%
  filter(`Body site` == "meconium") %>%
  arrange(PMID)

Show key characteristics of the included signatures:

select(subset.final, all_of(c("PMID", "Source", "Group 0 name", "Group 1 name", "Abundance in Group 1")))
##       PMID             Source                 Group 0 name       Group 1 name
## 1 27362264           Figure 1             vaginal delivery          C-section
## 2 28018325 Table 2 & Figure 2 vaginal delivery in mecomium C-section delivery
## 3 29459704           Figure 1             vaginal delivery C-section delivery
## 4 29459704           Figure 1             vaginal delivery C-section delivery
## 5 29538354            Table 3             vaginal delivery C-section delivery
## 6 32012716    Figure 4 & text             vaginal delivery c-section delivery
## 7 32012716    Figure 4 & text             vaginal delivery c-section delivery
##   Abundance in Group 1
## 1            decreased
## 2            decreased
## 3            increased
## 4            decreased
## 5            decreased
## 6            increased
## 7            decreased

Table of studies

Summary of taxa reported
